condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.3: Governmental and non-governmental partners have strengthened capacities and systems for emergency preparedness and response, and for implementing risk-informed programmes for children aged 6–18, particularly girls, especially in targeted, deprived areas.

description.narrative: From January to June 2020 UNICEF Angola achieved significant results for children aged 5-18 in two key responses: (1) mitigating the negative effects of the severe drought for 5,305 children aged 5-18 in vulnerable communities in Southern Angola; (2) supporting access to key services for children and youth during the COVID-19 pandemic. UNICEF has also been supporting INAC in development of a comprehensive Child Protection in Emergency protocol, to enhance the existing referral system by introducing different emergency scenarios the country may face, detailing roles and responsibilities of actors involved in emergency response. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020
